It does not. Wisdom is experience plus time. Knowledge is not wisdom. There seems to be a movement of self-learners. It’s good to self-learn, but… THERE IS NO SUBSTITUTE FOR EXPERIENCE!!! One of the issues with being self-taught is that you only get one perspective. One of the biggest strengths entrepreneurs possess, when they possess it, is an open-mind. One take on something does not an open mind make. The issue with one-sides knowledge is that without experience, one doesn’t know the value of experience. And for some ridiculous reason, the young don’t seem to understand that older people have been what they are going through, and have the experience. You do not want to go through a major part of your life without experience, to find the importance of it. You will have missed out on a whole lot of opportunity for experience. One of the top reasons people fail in business???? Lack of experience! Learn now or learn later. When we learn later, we often wish we would have learned sooner.

The way that I ‘see’ it, knowledge is of little use without wisdom. The problem for most of us is that we have listened to the falsehoods of society, believed that nonsense, and have little wisdom. We are taught lies so that others can keep us barely surviving in the many weak states of Fear and most humans still believe much (if not most0 of what they are taught. This is true even when we have a niggle, down deep, telling us that something is not quite Right with what we are being taught. Since a vast majority of what we have been taught is simply not True, as the universe would determine True, we are open for total control by others. Unfortunately those others are pretty nasty people. From decades of study, based on both my training and experience in Science, plus my life experiences and self-taught understandings from Philosophy, I now understand that we are eternal, spiritual beings having a series of trips in human bodies made of stardust. We have a Destiny of becoming Great examples of living Love, but are largely dissuaded away from that by society. Some will choose to grow in Love and many will choose to just barely survive in Fear. Choose your path!

Knowledge alone can not guarantee success if wisdom at first is not involved.What I mean is the only knowledge we know now is of shortened wisdom .People can tell other of their knowledge yet lack the ability to explain because wisdom is not involved. Wisdom and knowledge should be addressed together and never separated from one another because it is through Wisdom we find knowledge or through Knowledge we find Wisdom. This is different from person to person but based on the documents I read I could conclude by saying Wisdom is what we are looking for , meaning we look for wisdom with the navigation of knowledge . Success therefore need balance between the two if we maintain knowledge at 50% we still need to maintain Wisdom with 50% but it's tricky because Wisdom needs 100% and knowledge 100%

Knowledge acts as a foundation for wisdom. Learning is the process of understanding the how. Wisdom is understanding the when. Without a proper initial foundation then what you build upon it will become very flawed. An example of this is making a decision based upon bad information which results in a choice that is harmful. With proper knowledge higher quality choices can be made and experiences can be more easily learned from which makes gaining wisdom in those experiences much easier.

response.answer_text: Knowledge without implementation and without wisdom will not lead to success. Wisdom is to understand human nature and the human condition. When the people rise to revolt, it is sufficient evidence to prove that there was no wisdom in the leaders. Wise leaders would have anticipated the grievances of the people and prevent a revolt by meeting the needs of the people part way.

It doesn’t. Nor does knowledge WITH wisdom guarantee success. Nothing guarantees success unless you are e.g. a Trader with inside information that is actionable, e.g. Quora is going to IPO at $10.00 a share on Monday, and you have 1,000,000 shares that have been given to you when you were hired as a Leftwingnut Moderator

Yes. Though it depends how you define ‘success’. The world is full of successful people based on, for example, wealth accumulation. They acquire this wealth perhaps by luck but also by how they use their knowledge within their particular cultural and social setting. Wisdom is a much rarer commodity and is not necessarily found in people who own big houses, big cars and enjoy big lifestyles. Indeed, one might say that to spend one’s life in pursuit of wealth shows a distinct lack of wisdom. I could have a lot of knowledge about the world, but lack the wisdom to recognise myself in the world.

response.answer_text: It is one thing to know another to be wise. Knowledge does little good if you don't know how to use it, what is your purpose in life, or life is not structured. Wisdom brings order to your life and enables one to use his knowledge in accord with reason. With wisdom you order all things well and dispose of all things rightly--Aristotle.
Knowledge is information and without the experience of putting it into action you don’t have wisdom . It’s only experience that gives wisdom .
Knowledge is the tool by which wisdom activates it’s success. To have knowledge but without wisdom to direct it, would not guarantee the best outcome.

Knowledge is real, wisdom is ascribed. If you are wise you gather knowledge if you are foolish you don’t see the need for knowledge Wise applies to the action of accumulating the knowledge (ascribed by the writer)
